Module entities
Package controls

Class DatabaseControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • controls.DatabaseControl
  • public class DatabaseControl
extends java.lang.Object
    The DatabaseControl class defines methods that facilitate easy access to the user and school records in terms of courses, classes, enrollments, and so on.. A class that holds an instance of database control can use it to retrive, write and update the files stored on the database. The database in this class is built using binary files. Class Attributes: - temp: List, which is used to temporarily store the objects read in from the database. - domain: char, which specifies the access level according to the user type. In this case we have 'u' for undergraduate student access, and 's' for staff access. - tempPw: HashMap(String, String)

      • getStudentPassword

        public java.lang.String getStudentPassword​(java.lang.String userID)
        getStudentPassword() is used to read the student account password from the database, and can be used to verify the student trying to access the database.
        Parameters:
        userID - , which is the userID of the student trying to access the database.
        Returns:
        The password of the user. Returns null if the user does not exist in the database.

      • getStaffPassword

        Parameters:

      • addStudentPassword

        public boolean addStudentPassword​(java.lang.String userID,
                                  java.lang.String newPassword)
                           throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        addStudentPassword() is used to store the password for a specified user.
        Parameters:
        userID - , the userID for the corresponding password.
        newPassword - , the password being attached to the userID, which verifies the user.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the password was associated with the user and stored in the database successfully. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - This exception is thrown when a particular cryptographic algorithm is requested but is not available in the environment.

      • getStudentData

        public Student getStudentData​(java.lang.String userID)
        getStudentData() traverses the user Database to find the instance of a particular student using the userID.
        Parameters:
        userID - , which is the ID of the student instance we are trying to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the requested user data. If the corresonding user is not found, a null record is returned.

      • addStudentData

        public boolean addStudentData​(Student newUser)
        addStudentData() is used to add a new student object to the database, given that this student does not already exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        newUser - : Student, which is the new student instance being added to the database.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the student is successfully added to the database. false, if the student was not added to the database, or if the student already exists in the database.

        Parameters:
        newUser - : Staff, which is the new staff instance being added to the database.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the staff member is successfully added to the database. false, if the staff member was not added to the database, or if the staff member already exists in the database.

      • updateStudentData

        public boolean updateStudentData​(java.lang.String userID,
                                 Student updatedUser)
        updateStudentData() is used to update the record of an existing student after modifications are made to it. It traverses through the database to find the position of the student in it, and overwrites the instance with the new instance of the same student.
        Parameters:
        userID - , the userID of the student to identify the record.
        updatedUser - , the new student object, which will overwrite the old student object.
        Returns:
        true, if the student details were succesfully overwritte. false, if the student does not exist in the database or if the overwrite operation was unsuccessful.

        public Course getCourseData​(java.lang.String courseCode)
        getCourseData() traverses the course Database to find the instance of a particular course, which contains the corresponding indices, and lessons for the same.
        Parameters:
        courseCode - , which is the unique code of the course instance.
        Returns:
        the requested course data. If the corresonding course is not found, a null record is returned.

      • updateCourseData

        public boolean updateCourseData​(java.lang.String courseCode,
                                Course updatedCourse)
        updateCourseData() is used to update the record of an existing course after modifications are made to it. It traverses through the database to find the position of the course object in it, and overwrites the instance with the new instance of the same course.
        Parameters:
        courseCode - , which is the unique identifier of the course object.
        updatedCourse - , the new course object, which will overwrite the old course object.
        Returns:
        true, if the course details were successfully overwritten. false, if the course does not exist in the database or if the overwrite operation was unsuccessful.

      • getSchoolData

        public School getSchoolData​(int schoolID)
        getSchoolData() traverses the school Database to find the instance of a particular school, which contains the corresponding courses within the school.
        Parameters:
        schoolID - , which is the unique code of the school instance.
        Returns:
        the requested course data. If the corresponding school is not found, a null record is returned.

      • addSchoolData

        public boolean addSchoolData​(School newSchool)

        Parameters:
        newSchool - : school, which is the new course instance being added to the database.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the course is successfully added to the database. false, if the course was not added to the database, or if the course already exists in the database.

      • updateSchoolData

        public boolean updateSchoolData​(int schoolID,
                                School updatedSchool)
        updateSchoolData() is used to update the record of an existing school after modifications are made to it. It traverses through the database to find the position of the school object in it, and overwrites the instance with the new instance of the same school.
        Parameters:
        schoolID - , which is the unique identifier of the school or department.
        updatedSchool - : School, the new school object, which will overwrite the old school object.
        Returns:
        true, if the school details were successfully overwritten. false, if the school does not exist in the database or if the overwrite operation was unsuccessful.
